title: RobertClick
author: RobertClick
content: What happened: Just found another scam/clone website that sells mining asic miners, these guys are scamming for some time now, it looks to me that are the same guys behind linzhi.cn.comDomain was registered this month (2023-05-17) so it's clearly a clone, plus they use google ads to get ahead the official website.The official website is https://www.iceriver.ioReference Link:https://iceriver.cn.comWHOIS:Code:Domain Name: ICERIVER.CN.COMRegistry Domain ID: D368571516-CNICRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.netim.comRegistrar URL: http://www.netim.comUpdated Date: 2023-05-17T08:34:34.0ZCreation Date: 2023-05-17T08:27:11.0ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2024-05-17T23:59:59.0ZRegistrar: NETIMRegistrar IANA ID: 1519Domain Status: serverTransferProhibited https://icann.org/epp#serverTransferProhibitedDomain Status: clientTransferProhibited https://icann.org/epp#clientTransferProhibitedDomain Status: addPeriod https://icann.org/epp#addPeriodRegistrant Email: https://whois.centralnic.com/contact/iceriver.cn.com/registrantAdmin Email: https://whois.centralnic.com/contact/iceriver.cn.com/adminTech Email: https://whois.centralnic.com/contact/iceriver.cn.com/techName Server: ELAINE.NS.CLOUDFLARE.COMName Server: MAX.NS.CLOUDFLARE.COMDNSSEC: unsignedBilling Email: https://whois.centralnic.com/contact/iceriver.cn.com/billingRegistrar Abuse Contact Email: abuse@netim.netRegistrar Abuse Contact Phone:URL of the ICANN Whois Inaccuracy Complaint Form: https://www.icann.org/wicf/Payment Method: Only crypto and wire (no card or paypal), red flag!Archive: https://archive.ph/bPvxYReviews: NO REVIEWS!Additional Notes:I advise you not to purchase from iceriver.cn.comYou have been warned, be careful with this website!

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: RobertClick on May 21, 2023, 11:32:05 AMWhat happened: Just found another scam/clone website that sells mining asic miners, these guys are scamming for some time now, it looks to me that are the same guys behind linzhi.cn.comDomain was registered this month (2023-05-17) so it's clearly a clone, plus they use google ads to get ahead the official website.It looks like a very lucrative business for them and the scam always gets rampant during the bull market when mining is quite profitable with lots of newbies looking for mining gear to buy. Most of them dodge buying the hardware from official sites thinking that the alternatives are cheaper, only to get scammed.
